subject: Communication
title: Mirror Neurons and Emotional Resonance
description: A 60-second lesson on Mirror Neurons and Emotional Resonance.

hook.text: When you watch someone stub their toe, you wince. Your brain fires the same neurons as if YOU were hurt.

buildup.text: Mirror neurons, discovered by Giacomo Rizzolatti, fire both when we perform an action and when we observe someone else.

discovery.text: These neurons may be the neurological basis for empathy ‚Äî allowing us to literally simulate others' experiences in our.

twist.text: The mirror neuron theory of empathy is debated. Some researchers argue that empathy involves higher-level cognition.

climax.text: Whether through mirroring or reasoning, empathetic listening activates real neural pathways.

punchline.text: Empathy isn't just a feeling. It's your brain literally running someone else's.
